title.narrative: Finn Church Aid Global Programme 2018-2023 Just and resilient societies

description.narrative: Finn Church Aid (FCA) is the largest Finnish development cooperation organisation and the second largest provider of humanitarian assistance. FCA?s new programme continues its long-term work in fragile contexts while at the same time introducing new elemen ts that make work more contextually relevant and results-oriented. The impact goal for FCA's programme is derived from our vision: People in fragile contexts are empowered to act for positive and sustainable change in creating resilient and just societies. The need to address human rights violations discrimination inequality and exclusion in a comprehensive manner was already part of our work in the previous strategy period and is a fundamental principle of our transformative rights-based thinking.FCA?s pr ogramme architecture is using four dimensions (sectors themes modalities levels) in a ?whole-of society? logic. Our Theory of Change is structured in a way that it supports civil society governance and private sector interventions. Strongly anchored in the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) the programme considers three thematic areas as central to sustainable change. The themes are associated with sets of rights: people have the right to live in peace and acquire quality education and sustainable livelih oods. To promote positive and sustainable change FCA will work through different modalities namely development cooperation humanitarian aid and advocacy. During the programme period FCA will develop a fourth modality investment. The dimensions are interrel ated and interdependent and form our holistic programmatic approach which also includes gender equality and inclusion-specific concerns. The realization of these rights is most challenging in fragile contexts; therefore working and being present in such co ntexts remains a priority. Working on the development and humanitarian nexus also means that we are well positioned to work across funding instruments. FCA puts people?s resilience their wellbeing and the fulfilment of their rights at the center of its wor k. People globally are on the move. To protect their rights FCA moves with them.
